subject: Technology
title: The Vietnam War: TV Shows the Truth of War
description: A quick win: understand The Vietnam War: TV Shows the Truth of War.

hook.text: Vietnam was the first war broadcast into living rooms. Families watched combat footage over dinner. Public opinion collapsed.

buildup.text: TV journalists filmed the reality of war: wounded soldiers, burning villages, and grieving families, then broadcast it nightly.

discovery.text: Walter Cronkite called the war unwinnable on live TV. President Johnson said, 'If I've lost Cronkite, I've lost America.'

twist.text: The government had told the public the war was going well. Television revealed the truth, destroying trust in official narratives.

climax.text: Anti-war protests surged. Television's visual power did what newspaper reports alone never could: it made war unbearable to watch.

punchline.text: Television didn't end the Vietnam War. But it showed people why it should end.

quiz.question: Why was Vietnam called the 'first television war'?
options: Combat footage was broadcast into homes nightly, shifting public opinion
The war was fought over TV broadcasting rights
